subject: Cricket
lead_paragraph: Geoff Lawson, the former Australia fast bowler, said he had been appointed coach of the Pakistan cricket team to succeed Bob Woolmer, who died four months ago at the World Cup.Lawson, 49, said in an interview with Australia’s Sky News that Pakistan Cricket Board officials called him yesterday to confirm his appointment. The board was set to make an announcement today, Lawson said.
